**Tornado** is a level 9 [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") spell which creates a vortex of raging wind around you.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Tornado creates [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud") of raging wind, dealing a base of `9d(pow/15)` physical damage per 1.0 turn.

The damage is then adjusted by:

- Percentage of tiles open. In tight spaces, damage is reduced. Damage is multiplied by the ratio, `(tiles with wind) / (tiles that could have wind)`.
- "Duration-radius" factor. Creatures on the outside of the vortex will receive the most damage.

Tornado's radius is equal to `sqrt(aut_passed) * 7/5`, max. 5 tiles. Creatures and [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud") caught inside will rotate in a counterclockwise fashion. The "rotation" is a square shape, and done at a rate of \~1 full rotation per 6 turns.

While casting the spell, the caster and anything caught inside will [fly](/Fly "Fly") for a short period of time. Once it ends, there's a grace period of 1 turn until flight ends. Monsters won't make any effort to avoid falling into [deep water](/Deep_water "Deep water") or [lava](/Lava "Lava").

Tornado lasts for 6 turns. It immediately ends if you [blink](/Blink "Blink") or [teleport](/Teleport "Teleport"), or if you enter another floor. After it ends, it has a cooldown of 3.5 - 4.5 turns.

Creatures with rTornado ([Sojobo](/Sojobo "Sojobo"), [air elementals](/Air_elemental "Air elemental")) are immune to this spell. Also, those who are currently casting Tornado are immune to hostile Tornadoes.

## Strategy

While Tornado has worse damage/turn than other level 9 spells, it has great MP efficiency and irresistible damage. For a single, 9 MP cast, you'll get up to 6 turns of damage. Plus, you can cast other spells while the tornado is running. Great in an open area, especially against crowds.

The downsides (other than damage/turn) mostly stem from the tornado mechanic itself. It is much weaker in a cramped area. For most of the duration, the tornado has a short radius. And, the spell has a lengthy cooldown.

As a single school spell, Tornado is easier to train than the likes of [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm"). Regardless, as a level 9 spell, it is a significant XP investment (for a 3 rune game). In a 3 rune game, training for a level 9 spell usually means sacrificing on your defenses. But, for a low-range, damage over time spell that excels in open areas, you'll want good defenses. Tornado can still be worth it, but don't rush for it.

### Tips & Tricks

- When the radius is 5, the amount of noise is 15. This number is multiplied by the delay of your last action (in [auts](/Aut "Aut")) and divided by 10.
- Any [trees](/Tree "Tree") within Tornado's range have a chance of being destroyed by the spell.
- Be careful not to use [Blink](/Blink "Blink") while the spell is up unless you specifically want to end its effects.

## History

- In [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Tornado was replaced with [Polar Vortex](/Polar_Vortex "Polar Vortex"). Polar Vortex is functionally similar, but is a level 9 [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic") spell which deals 33% more damage and is 40% resistible by cold. rTornado/rVortex was also removed from air elementals and Sojobo.
- Prior to [0.22](/0.22 "0.22"), rTornado was called wind resistance, and also affected [Airstrike](/Airstrike "Airstrike").
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), Tornado was a circle (range 6) and rotated circularly.
- Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), Tornado was slightly weaker.
- Prior to [0.9](/0.9 "0.9"), Tornado had stronger damage, didn't rotate monsters around, and didn't have a cooldown, but had a negative [spell enhancer](/Spell_enhancer "Spell enhancer").
- Tornado was added in [0.8](/0.8 "0.8").
